definition: to place (hope, importance etc) on/to express/to show/to give
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)

sentences.english: Liao Minhui had aspirations for his daughter.
sentences.chinese: 廖民輝對他的女兒寄予厚望。

sentences.english: Before the endgame, the gods have placed the middlegame. - Tarrasch.
sentences.chinese: 殘局以前，上帝已寄予了中局。

sentences.english: No. In the days when the Internet was young, our hopes were high.
sentences.chinese: 在英特網初期的時候，我們對它寄予很高的期望。

sentences.english: Event information will be sent out one week before the competition.
sentences.chinese: 賽事資料將於賽事舉行前一星期寄予賽員。

sentences.english: In fairness, you probably haven't got high hopes for this year's movie adaptation of The Smurfs.
sentences.chinese: 公平地說，你可能不會對改編的電影藍精靈寄予厚望。

sentences.english: The American government attached great importance to this mission and placed high hope on Parker.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府非常重視此次修約之事，對伯駕寄予厚望。

sentences.english: A diesel will follow next year, on which Subaru is pinning high hopes.
sentences.chinese: 柴油將遵循明年，這是斯巴魯寄予很高的期望。

sentences.english: Parents usually expect too much of their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母通常都對子女寄予過大希望。

sentences.english: And it quells the constant buzz in the mind and the breaking of the silence in the soul.
sentences.chinese: 它寄予不斷流行在他心中，並打破了沉默，在靈魂。

sentences.english: Apple is pinning big hopes on its new store in Covent Garden. Photograph: Jonathan Hordle/Rex Features
sentences.chinese: 蘋果公司對考文特花園新店寄予厚望。

sentences.english: It tells us the formation and development history of the sea-weed house.
sentences.chinese: 對海草房在威海城市發展中的明天寄予希望。

sentences.english: He also has great hope for the country's solar energy potential.
sentences.chinese: 他同時對國家的太陽能潛力寄予厚望。

sentences.english: Houju Chang to listen to the briefing, on the clouds of sulfur pinned hopes for future development.
sentences.chinese: 侯局長聽取介紹後，對雲硫今後發展寄予了希望。

sentences.english: The company also has high hopes for an upcoming sedan called G6.
sentences.chinese: 比亞迪還對即將推出的轎車G6寄予厚望。

sentences.english: The state places great hopes on the younger generation.
sentences.chinese: 國家對青年一代寄予很大的希望。

sentences.english: Residents and authorities had been pinning their hopes sandbagging.
sentences.chinese: 當地居民和政府正在縫製他們寄予希望的沙袋。

definition: to entrust (to sb)/to place (one's hope, energy etc) in/a thing in which you invest (your hope, energy etc)
hope and expectation/to anticipate/to look forward to/to await expectantly
to fail to live up (to expectations)/unworthy (of trust)/to let down/to betray (hopes)/to disappoint
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
